snippet: The state’s indisputably defective death penalty system is made more horrifying by attempts to rush inmates to execution. Gov. Rick Scott should veto the Timely Justice Act.
abstract: Editorial calls on Florida Gov Rick Scott to veto grotesquely named Timely Justice Act, which would rush inmates to execution in capital convictions; cites case of Florida death row inmate Clemente Javier Aguirre-Jarguin, whose 2006 conviction could be overturned by DNA evidence, as good reason to reject bill; contends that Florida's flawed capital punishment system cannot be fixed, and capital punishment should be abolished.
lead_paragraph: The state’s indisputably defective death penalty system is made more horrifying by attempts to rush inmates to execution. Gov. Rick Scott should veto the Timely Justice Act.
